item.title: 001 Use the marker to select from the following structures the B one /B with the IUPAC-name B 2,5-dibromo-4-ethylnon-4-ene /B . BR BR CENTER

material.mattext: This is the correct structure, numbered as shown.

This is not the correct structure. Numbering from the right hand side, this structure is:
2,4-dibromo-5-ethylnon-4-ene (top left figure)

This is not the correct structure. Numbering from the left hand side, this structure is:
5,8-dibromo-6-ethylnon-4-ene (bottom left figure)

This is not the correct structure. Numbering from the left hand side, this structure is:
3,6-dibromo-7-ethylnon-4-ene (bottom right figure)

item.title: 002 The charge in hybridisatio

material.mattext: This is not the correct answer. Carbonyl carbon atoms are sp2 hybridised, and nitrile (cyanide) carbon atoms are sp hybridised. The change shown is therefore sp2 to sp.
This is not the correct answer. Carbonyl carbon atoms are sp2 hybridised, and nitrile (cyanide) carbon atoms are sp hybridised. The change shown is therefore sp2 to sp.
This is not the correct answer. Carbonyl carbon atoms are sp2 hybridised, and nitrile (cyanide) carbon atoms are sp hybridised. The change shown is therefore sp2 to sp.
This is not the correct answer. Carbonyl carbon atoms are sp2 hybridised, and nitrile (cyanide) carbon atoms are sp hybridised. The change shown is therefore sp2 to sp.

item.title: 003 Which of the following types of

material.mattext: This is not the correct answer. A ketone consists of a carbonyl group attached to two alkyl groups. The structure shown has carbonyl groups attached to an alkyl group and oxygen. The correct answer is anhydride.
This is not the correct answer. A carbonate group has the structure -O.CO.O-, but this compound has the structure -CO.O.CO-. The correct answer is anhydride.
This is not the correct answer. A lactone is a cyclic ester. It therefore has only the group -O.CO- in its structure, not the group -CO.O.CO-. The correct answer is anhydride.

item.title: 004n Use the marker to select which B one /B of the structures B A, B, C /B or B D /B has a different configuration from structure B 1 /B . BR BR CENTER

material.mattext: This is not the correct structure. It has the R- configuration, and so does structure 1; you should have identified a structure with the S- configuration, i.e. structure C.

item.title: 005 Which one of the following seri

material.mattext: This is not the correct answer. A nucleophile is a species that has an available pair of electrons that it can use to form a bond. All these species are nucleophiles except BF4-, which can generate the nucleophile F-, but is not one itself. The correct answer is NH3; H2O; CN-; I-.

This is not the correct answer. A nucleophile is a species that has an available pair of electrons that it can use to form a bond. All these species are nucleophiles except BH3, which is an electrophile. It has a space to accept a pair of electrons to form a bond. The correct answer is NH3; H2O; CN-; I-.

This is not the correct answer. A nucleophile is a species that has an available pair of electrons that it can use to form a bond. None of these species is a nucleophile. BF3, AlCl3 and NO2+ are electrophiles, each of which has a space to accept a pair of electrons to form a bond. Me3O+ can generate the electrophile Me+. The correct answer is NH3; H2O; CN-; I-.

item.title: 006 Which of the following solvents

material.mattext: This is not the correct answer. Ethanol does not form peroxides. The correct answer is Diethyl ether.
This is not the correct answer. Dimethylformamide (DMF) does not form peroxides. The correct answer is Diethyl ether.
This is not the correct answer. t-Butyl methyl ether (MTBE) does not form peroxides. The correct answer is Diethyl ether.

item.title: 007 Which aromatic compound of

material.mattext: This is the correct answer. m-Xylene has two unique and three pairs of magnetically equivalent carbon atoms, and so shows five peaks in its 13C NMR spectrum.
This is not the correct answer. o-Xylene has four pairs of magnetically equivalent carbon atoms, and so shows four peaks in its 13C NMR spectrum. The correct answer is m-xylene.
This is not the correct answer. p-Xylene has three sets of magnetically equivalent carbon atoms, and so shows three peaks in its 13C NMR spectrum. The correct answer is m-xylene.
This is not the correct answer. Ethyl-benzene has four unique and two pairs of magnetically equivalent carbon atoms, and so shows six peaks in its 13C NMR spectrum. The correct answer is m-xylene.

item.title: 008 Use the marker to select which would be the major product in the following reaction. BR BR CENTER

material.mattext: Multiple Drag and Drop questions are not yet supported

item.title: 009 Put question wording here and p

material.mattext: This is not the correct statement. The ion separation in E1 elimination reactions is accelerated by the use of a polar solvating solvent, therefore reactions in water are faster. The correct answer is: The E1 mechanism is a two-step mechanism with a positively charged intermediate.

This is not the correct statement. The base does not participate in E1 elimination reaction; the initial step is the separation of the leaving group. A strong base is more likely to bring about E2 elimination. The correct answer is: The E1 mechanism is a two-step mechanism with a positively charged intermediate.

This is not the correct statement. After the loss of the leaving group, free rotation is possible in the intermediate. As a result all possible stereo-products of elimination are formed, with the E-isomers predominating. The correct answer is: The E1 mechanism is a two-step mechanism with a positively charged intermediate.

item.title: 010 Put question wording here and p

material.mattext: This is the correct sequence. This reaction scheme would begin by nitrating benzene. Br2/FeBr3 will brominate the nitrobenzene in the meta-position, but nitrobenzene is highly deactivated towards electrophilic aromatic substitution, so yields could be poor. Further reaction with Fe/HCl would result meta-bromoaniline, although some bromine could be lost under the reducing conditions, leaving aniline.

This is not the correct sequence. This reaction scheme would begin by mononitration of benzene. The Fe/HCl reagent would then reduce the nitro group to an amino group. Further reaction with the Br2/FeBr3 reagent will brominate the aminobenzene at the o- and p-positions. The correct sequence is:
1. HNO3/H2SO4  ;  2. Br2/FeBr3  ;  3. Fe/HCl.

This is not the correct sequence. This reaction scheme would begin by brominating benzene. The nitrating reagent, HNO3/H2SO4, would then nitrate bromobenzene in the ortho- and para-positions. Further reaction with Fe/HCl would result in a mixture of ortho- and para-bromoaniline, although some bromine could be lost under the reducing conditions, leaving aniline. The correct sequence is:
1. HNO3/H2SO4  ;  2. Br2/FeBr3  ;  3. Fe/HCl.

This is not the correct sequence. This reaction scheme would begin by nitrating benzene. Br2/FeBr3 will brominate the nitrobenzene in the meta-position, but nitrobenzene is highly deactivated towards electrophilic aromatic substitution, so yields could be poor. Further reaction with NaNH2 would result in the loss of -Br from the ring, and its replacement by -NH2, o-, m-, or p- to the nitro group, by the benzyne mechanism. The correct sequence is:
1. HNO3/H2SO4  ;  2. Br2/FeBr3  ;  3. Fe/HCl.

item.title: 011 Put in here whatever rich

material.mattext: This is the correct statement. The product is 3-methylpentan-3-ol.

This is not the correct statement. C2H5COOCH3 reacts with C2H5MgBr then H+/H2O to give 3-ethylpentan-3-ol, whereas CH3COOC2H5 reacts with C2H5MgBr then H+/H2O to give 3-methylpentan-3-ol. The correct statement is: CH3COOCH3 and CH3COOC6H5 give the same tertiary alcohol when treated with excess C2H5MgBr followed by H+/H2O.

This is not the correct statement. Acetone reacts with C2H5MgBr then H+/H2O to give the tertiary alcohol, 2-methylbutan-2-ol; whereas acetaldehyde reacts with C2H5MgBr then H+/H2O to give the secondary alcohol, butan-2-ol. The correct statement is: CH3COOCH3 and CH3COOC6H5 give the same tertiary alcohol when treated with excess C2H5MgBr followed by H+/H2O.

This is not the correct statement. Esters react with excess C2H5MgBr followed by H+/H2O to give tertiary alcohols. The correct statement is: CH3COOCH3 and CH3COOC6H5 give the same tertiary alcohol when treated with excess C2H5MgBr followed by H+/H2O.

item.title: 012 Use the marker to select which B one /B of the alkenes shown below gives ethanal and butan-2-one when subjected to ozonolysis. BR CENTER

material.mattext: This is the correct alkene.
This is not the correct alkene. The products of ozonolysis would be methanal and butanal. The correct alkene is 3-methylpent-2-ene (A).
This is not the correct alkene. The products of ozonolysis would be ethanal and propanone. The correct alkene is 3-methylpent-2-ene (A).
This is not the correct alkene. The products of ozonolysis would be ethanal and 2-methylpropanal. The correct alkene is 3-methylpent-2-ene (A).
This is not the correct alkene. The products of ozonolysis would be propanal and butan-2-one. The correct alkene is 3-methylpent-2-ene (A).

item.title: 013 Suggest the most suitable

material.mattext: This is the correct reagent. NaBH4 in methanol only reduces ester groups very slowly.
This is not the correct reagent. LiAlH4 in diethyl ether would reduce both carbonyl functions to yield para-bis(hydroxymethyl)benzene. The correct reagent is NaBH4 in methanol.
This is not the correct reagent. H2, Pd-C in methanol would reduce both carbonyl functions to -CH2OH. The correct reagent is NaBH4 in methanol.

This is not the correct reagent. NaH in tetrahydrofuran is used as a strong base, but infrequently used as a reducing agent, and then in specialised applications. The correct reagent is NaBH4 in methanol.

item.title: 014 The1H-NMR spectrum of diet

material.mattext: This anion is the weakest base. The weakest bases are formed from the strongest conjugate acids. The strongest acid in this list is C6H5SO3H, so this anion will be the weakest base.

This anion is not the weakest base. The weakest bases are formed from the strongest conjugate acids. The strongest acid in this list is C6H5SO3H, so the weakest base will be C6H5SO3-. The anion C2H5O- is the strongest base in the list.
This anion is not the weakest base. The weakest bases are formed from the strongest conjugate acids. The strongest acid in this list is C6H5SO3H, so the weakest base will be C6H5SO3-.

item.title: 015n Use the marker to select which B one /B of the following peroxides is most easily formed from the corresponding hydrocarbon by auto-oxidation via a radical reaction. BR BR CENTER

material.mattext: This is the correct peroxide. Radical abstraction of a hydrogen atom does occur from benzylic hydrocarbons, giving with 2-propylbenzene the stable tertiary radical that leads to this product.

This is not the correct peroxide. Radical abstraction of a hydrogen atom does occur from benzylic hydrocarbons, but the primary radical formed is not as stable as the tertiary radical leading to the correct peroxide, A.
This is not the correct peroxide. Radical abstraction of a hydrogen atom directly attached to a benzene ring does not occur readily. The correct peroxide is compound A.

This is not the correct peroxide. A more stable radical is formed by the abstraction of the tertiary hydrogen atom from the 2-propyl sidechain than from either of the methyl groups. The correct peroxide is compound A.

item.title: 016n Use the marker to select which B one /B of the following structures would be predicted to be aromatic according to H& 252;ckels rule. BR BR CENTER

material.mattext: This is the correct structure. It is cyclic, conjugated and has six p electrons, thus conforming to Hückel’s (4n +2) p electron rule.
This is not the correct structure. Hückel’s rule ascribes aromaticity to conjugated cyclic structures with (4n +2) p electrons.
Cyclooctatetraene is not conjugated because it is not planar and has eight p electrons. The correct structure is the tropylium cation A, with six p electrons.
The tropylium anion is conjugated but has eight p electrons. The correct structure is the tropylium cation A, with six p electrons.
The cyclopentadienyl cation is conjugated but has four p electrons. The correct structure is the tropylium cation A, with six p electrons.
The cyclohexadiene anion has six p electrons, but is not a completely conjugated cyclic system. The correct structure is the tropylium cation A, with six p electrons.

item.title: 017 Put question wording here and p

material.mattext: This is the correct answer- see below :
This is not the correct answer.Two meso compound are possible but only one pair of enantiomers. The correct answer is "4 (1 Pair of enantiomers plus 2 meso compounds)" - see below :

This is not the correct answer.One pair of enantiomers is possible but there are also two meso compounds. The correct answer is "4 (1 Pair of enantiomers plus 2 meso compounds)" - see below
:
This is not the correct answer.Only one pair of enantiomers is possible, together with two meso compounds. The correct answer is "4 (1 Pair of enantiomers plus 2 meso compounds)" - see below :

item.title: 018 Match the compounds A-D with th

material.mattext:
Correct. This is the complete 1H NMR spectrum of compound 3. The methyl group gives the 3-proton signal at d = 1.70 ppm, and the two alkene protons give separate signals at lower field.
1H NMR: d = 1.70 (3H), 5.85 (1H) and 6.05 (1H)

This is not the correct answer. This is the complete 1H NMR spectrum of compound 3. The methyl group gives the 3-proton signal at d = 1.70 ppm, and the two alkene protons give separate signals at lower field.
1H NMR: d = 1.70 (3H), 5.85 (1H) and 6.05 (1H)

Correct. This is the alkene region of the 13C NMR spectrum of compound 4. The singlet shows no H atoms are attached to one end of the C=C.
13C NMR: d = 111.8 (singlet) and 131.7 (triplet)

This is not the correct answer. This is the alkene region of the 13C NMR spectrum of compound 4. The singlet shows no H atoms are attached to one end of the C=C.
13C NMR: d = 111.8 (singlet) and 131.7 (triplet)

Correct. This is part of the fingerprint region in the IR spectrum of compound 2. These two absorptions are due to out-of-plane deformations of the C-H bonds of a terminal alkene.
IR: 990 cm-1 (strong) and 910 cm-1

This is not the correct answer. This is part of the fingerprint region in the IR spectrum of compound 2. These two absorptions are due to out-of-plane deformations of the C-H bonds of a terminal alkene.
IR: 990 cm-1 (strong) and 910 cm-1

Correct. This is the complete 1H NMR spectrum of compound 1. The four protons of the two CH2 groups show the characteristic highfield chemical shift of cyclopropanes, while the single proton is brought to lower field by the adjacent electronegative chlorine.
1H NMR: d = 0.3 (4H, multiplet) and 3.0 1H, multiplet)

This is not the correct answer. This is the complete 1H NMR spectrum of compound 1. The four protons of the two CH2 groups show the characteristic highfield chemical shift of cyclopropanes, while the single proton is brought to lower field by the adjacent electronegative chlorine.
1H NMR: d = 0.3 (4H, multiplet) and 3.0 (1H, multiplet)

item.title: 019n Use the marker to select which B one /B of the structures shown below represents the dimer which is formed from cyclopentadiene at room temperature. BR BR CENTER

material.mattext: This is the correct structure, formed in a (4p + 2p) concerted cycloaddition (Diels Alder) reaction.
This is not the correct structure. The double bond is in the wrong position for the (4p + 2p) concerted cycloaddition (Diels Alder) reaction. The correct structure is A.

This is not the correct structure. This product is the result of a thermally disallowed (2p + 2p) concerted cycloaddition. The correct structure, formed in a (4p + 2p) concerted cycloaddition (Diels Alder) reaction, is A.

This is not the correct structure. This product is the result of a thermally disallowed (4p + 4p) concerted cycloaddition. The correct structure, formed in a (4p + 2p) concerted cycloaddition (Diels Alder) reaction, is A.

item.title: 020n Use the marker to select which B one /B of the compounds shown below will give a deuterium-free main product on treatment with potassium tert.butoxide (KOBu SUP t /SUP  ) in HOBu SUP t /SU

material.mattext: This is the correct compound. Treatment with potassium tert-butoxide in HOBut will result in an antiperiplanar b-elimination, from the preferred conformation (shown), so more DBr than HBr will be eliminated.
This is not the correct compound. Treatment with potassium tert-butoxide in HOBut will result in a b-elimination, leaving the deuterium in the a-position untouched. The correct compound is A.

This is not the correct compound. Treatment with potassium tert-butoxide in HOBut will result in an antiperiplanar b-elimination, from the preferred conformation (shown), so more HBr than DBr will be eliminated. The correct compound is A.

This is not the correct compound. Treatment with potassium tert-butoxide in HOBut will result in an antiperiplanar b-elimination. As there are four possible H atoms and only one D atom that can be eliminated, more HBr than DBr will be lost. The correct compound is A.

item.title: 021n Use the marker to select which B one /B of the compounds shown below is the major product of the reaction of ester  B 1 /B with sodium metal followed by hydrolysis. BR BR CENTER

material.mattext: This is the correct compound, formed in an acyloin condensation, brought about by the action of sodium in ether with an ester.

This is not the correct compound. Sodium in ether brings about an acyloin condensation with esters, to yield the product A - the correct choice. A further oxidation step would be required to produce the diketone.

This is not the correct compound. Sodium in ether brings about an acyloin condensation with esters, to yield the product A - the correct choice. A further dehydration step would be required to produce the enone.

This is not the correct compound. Sodium in ether brings about an acyloin condensation with esters, to yield the product A - the correct choice. This product is formed in a Claisen condensation, brought about by the action of sodium methoxide in methanol on the ester.

item.title: 022 Suggest the most suitable

material.mattext: This is the correct answer. Since the methyl group has the lower migratory aptitude, the phenyl group will migrate to the peroxy oxygen.

This is not the correct answer. Since the methyl group has the lower migratory aptitude, the phenyl group will migrate to the peroxy oxygen, generating phenol (not methanol). The correct answer is: acetic acid and phenol.

This is not the correct answer. The Baeyer-Villiger oxidation inserts an oxygen at the carbon of the carbonyl group, but does not affect the benzene ring. The correct answer is: acetic acid and phenol.

This is not the correct answer. Since the methyl group has the lower migratory aptitude, the phenyl group will migrate to the peroxy oxygen, generating phenol (not methanol). The correct answer is: acetic acid and phenol.

item.title: 023 Put question wording here and p

material.mattext: This is the correct answer, i.e. first form the ester before using the organometallic reagent.

This is not the correct set of reagents and conditions. A Grignard reagent would only react once with the carboxylic acid to generate the salt and a hydrocarbon (methane). After acid hydrolysis the carboxylic acid would be regenerated.
This is not the correct set of reagents and conditions. Two equivalents of organometallic reagent would react with a carboxylic acid to generate a ketone (hexan-2-one), after hydrolysis.

This is not the correct set of reagents and conditions. The organometallic reagent would only react once with the carboxylic acid to generate the salt and a hydrocarbon (methane). After acid hydrolysis the carboxylic acid would be regenerated.

The correct answer is:
1. C6H5OH/H+  ;  2. CH3MgBr (2 eq) then H+/H2O
i.e. first form the ester before using the organometallic reagent.

item.title: 024n Use the marker to select which B one /B of the amino esters (1 mole) shown below reacts with 2 moles of acetic anhydride and gives no N SUB 2 /SUB on treatment with HNO SUB 2 /SUB .

material.mattext: This is the correct amino ester.
This is not the correct amino ester. It will only react with one mole of acetic anhydride, even though it does not give N2 on treatment with HNO2. The correct amino ester is A.
This is not the correct amino ester. It will react with two moles of acetic anhydride, but it does give N2 on treatment with HNO2. The correct amino ester is A.
This is not the correct amino ester. It will react with two moles of acetic anhydride, but it does give N2 on treatment with HNO2. The correct amino ester is A.
This is not the correct amino ester. It will react with three moles of acetic anhydride, and it also gives N2 on treatment with HNO2. The correct amino ester is A.

item.title: 025 Which aromatic compound of

material.mattext: This is the correct description for this type of polymer, with the functional groups or side chains alternating down the length of the polymer.

This is not the correct description for this type of polymer. Isotactic polymers have all their functional groups or side chains on the same side. The correct description is syndiotactic polypropylene.

This is not the correct description for this type of polymer. Atactic polymers have their functional groups or side chains oriented at random down the length of the chain. The correct description is syndiotactic polypropylene.

This is not the correct description for this type of polymer. A polymer cannot be described as syndiotactic, isotactic, or atactic unless it has attached functional groups or side chains. Polyethylene does not. The correct description is syndiotactic polypropylene.

item.title: 026n Use the marker to select which B one /B of the Fischer projections shown below correctly represents compound  B 1 /B . BR BR CENTER

material.mattext: This is the correct Fischer projection to represent 1 :

This is not the correct Fischer projection:   
To give structure 1, the Br and the CH3 must be interchanged. The correct projection is A :

This is not the correct Fischer projection:   
To give structure 1, the CH3 and the CO2H must be interchanged. The correct projection is A :

This is not the correct Fischer projection:   
To give structure 1, the H and the D must be interchanged. The correct projection is A :

item.title: 027n Use the marker to select which B one /B of the stereoisomers of 1,2,3,4,5,6-hexahydroxycyclohexane shown below has the following spectroscopic properties in D SUB 2 /SUB O. BR BR Table b

material.mattext: This is the stereoisomer which fits the spectroscopic data given. The carbon atoms are in four distinct magnetic (structural) environments, giving rise to the 13C NMR spectrum given. There are also four distinct proton environments, fitting the 1H NMR spectrum given.

This is not the correct stereoisomer. All carbon atoms are in an identical magnetic (structural) environment, and so the 13C NMR spectrum would show only one signal, not the 13C NMR spectrum given. The correct stereoisomer is A.

This is not the correct stereoisomer. The carbon atoms are in only two distinct magnetic (structural) environments, which would give rise to two signals, not the 13C NMR spectrum given. The correct stereoisomer is A.

This is not the correct stereoisomer. The carbon atoms are in three distinct magnetic (structural) environments, which would give rise to three signals, not the 13C NMR spectrum given. The correct stereoisomer is A.

item.title: 028* Put the question wording here a

material.mattext:
Step ‘a’ requires magnesium amalgam (Mg-Hg) to bring about a pinacol reaction.
In step ‘b’ the pinacol rearranges when treated with hydrochloric acid (HCl).
Sodium borohydride (NaBH4) is used in step ‘c’ to reduce the ketone to a secondary alcohol;
and in step ‘d’ the alcohol is methylated to a methyl ether with NaH and methyl iodide.

item.title: 029n Use the marker to select the B one /B of the five SUB /SUB OH-groups of FONT FACE=SYMBOL b /FONT -D-glucose which is easily substituted by OCH SUB 3 /SUB on treatment with hydrochloric acid

material.mattext: Only one of the five OH groups is readily substituted by OCH3 on treatment with hydrochloric acid in methanol. It is the one on the carbon atom adjacent to the oxygen atom in the ring - the hemiacetal OH, marked with an asterisk (*).

item.title: 030n Use the marker to select which one of the compounds shown below is predominantly formed in the reaction of pyridine with phenyl lithium and subsequent addition of D SUB 2 /SUB O. BR BR CENTE

material.mattext: This is the correct compound. Pyridine undergoes nucleophilic aromatic substitution in the 2-position. Deuterium is not incorporated into the product but forms D-H from the initially formed complex.

Pyridine undergoes nucleophilic aromatic substitution in the 2-position. Deuterium is not incorporated into the product but forms D-H from the initially formed complex.
The correct product is 2-phenylpyridine :
